content.summary: Bootleg Fire burn severity analysis complete. 413,765 acres burned with 53% high severity - largest fire in US for 2021. Ten burn sectors identified across Fremont-Winema NF.
content.detail: MTBS analysis reveals catastrophic fire behavior driven by extreme drought conditions and beetle-killed timber fuel loads. High severity concentrated in Sprague River drainage and Gearhart Mountain slopes. Sycan Marsh buffer zones showed reduced severity due to wet conditions. Priority reforestation zones identified in Summer Lake Basin where seed sources were eliminated. Critical watershed protection needed for Sprague River North sector.

content.summary: Critical trail infrastructure damage across 6 trails. 18 damage points identified including 4 bridge failures. Historic OC&E trestle requires emergency structural assessment. Total repair estimate: $1.2M.
content.detail: The Bootleg Fire severely impacted the Fremont-Winema trail network. Most critically, the historic OC&E Woods Line trestle (FRWN-520-DP01) sustained significant structural damage and requires immediate engineering assessment - estimated repair cost $320K alone. The Fremont NRT has 42.5 miles within fire perimeter with complete Sprague River crossing failure. Gearhart Mountain Trail corridor is impassable due to dense lodgepole snag field. Klamath Tribes Heritage Trail damage requires tribal consultation before any repair work.

content.summary: Timber salvage assessment: 8 plots surveyed, 77.1 MBF identified. Two highest-priority units (BOOT-47-ALPHA, BOOT-17-GOLF) contain premium ponderosa pine. 18-month salvage window before beetle damage reduces value.
content.detail: Cruise data reveals substantial salvage opportunity in fire-killed ponderosa pine and lodgepole stands. Sprague River Unit A (BOOT-47-ALPHA) offers 14.1 MBF/acre of premium ponderosa with excellent road access and staging area. Yamsay Flats (BOOT-17-GOLF) contains large-diameter ponderosa sawlogs at 11.4 MBF/acre on flat terrain. Gearhart West Unit requires road reconstruction before access. Summer Lake Rim unit has high extraction costs due to remote location and steep terrain - recommend deferral. Northern spotted owl surveys required before operations in Bly Mountain North unit.

content.summary: NEPA pathway analysis complete. Emergency Situation Determination (ESD) available for 180 days post-declaration. Tribal consultation MANDATORY for 2 units. Northern spotted owl protocol surveys required before Bly Mountain operations.
content.detail: The Bootleg Fire qualifies for expedited NEPA review under multiple authorities. Categorical Exclusion applies for hazard tree removal along roads and trails (250-acre limit). Emergency Situation Determination allows expedited EA for priority salvage units - deadline November 2021 for 180-day window. Two critical constraints: (1) Klamath Tribes consultation required for any activities near Heritage Trail and Chiloquin Buffer - formal government-to-government consultation process, minimum 60 days; (2) Northern spotted owl surveys required in Bly Mountain unit before any ground-disturbing activities - survey season March-August. Wilderness adjacency at Gearhart requires additional NEPA analysis for any mechanized equipment.

content.summary: Bootleg Fire Recovery Plan synthesized. Priority actions: (1) Tribal consultation initiation, (2) ESD filing for salvage, (3) Trail hazard removal CE. Critical path: 60-day tribal consultation + 6-month owl surveys constrain Bly Mountain timeline.
content.detail: Cross-agent synthesis complete for Bootleg Fire - the largest 2021 US wildfire at 413,765 acres. Immediate actions center on regulatory compliance to unlock operational flexibility. Tribal consultation with Klamath Tribes is the critical path item - 60-day minimum process affects Heritage Trail restoration and Chiloquin Buffer operations. ESD documentation should be filed immediately to preserve expedited EA option for salvage. Trail hazard removal under CE can proceed in parallel. Timber salvage prioritization: Sprague River Unit A first (premium ponderosa, good access), followed by Yamsay Flats (large diameter, flat terrain). Bly Mountain deferred pending owl surveys. Total recovery investment estimated at $1.2M trails + $2.8M salvage preparation = $4.0M, with potential salvage revenue of $27.1M.
